titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Susan Myra Kingsbury (1870-1949) was an early social welfare expert. She received a bachelor's degree from the College of the Pacific in 1890, and was a history teacher at Lowell High School in San Francisco (1892-1900). She received a master's degree in history from Stanford University in 1899. In 1905 she received a Ph.D. from Columbia University. She was a professor of economics at Simmons College (1906-1915) and professor and head of the Graduate Department of Social Economics and Social Research (later the School of Social Work) at Bryn Mawr College (1915-1949).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the professional papers of Susan M. Kingsbury. Materials include research notebooks related to studies of the conditions of women workers and war relief work; correspondence related to the Study of Women in Industry; incoming and outgoing departmental correspondence from Bryn's Mawr's Department of Social Economics (1917-1940), including letters of recommendation, advice to students and updates from students on their research and academic endeavors; clippings on Kingsbury's work on the Prohibition Committee; and biographical information about Kingsbury from the Public Information department of Bryn Mawr College.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Bryn Mawr College Graduate School of Social Work and Social Research records.
